channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New York Giants hire John Harbaugh as coach after identifying him as their top choice
item.description: Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.
item.content:encoded:
Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Escalating tensions in Minnesota
item.description: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: NASA's Artemis II craft meets the launch pad ahead of crewed lunar orbit
item.description: Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.
item.content:encoded:
Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.

(Image credit: Derek Demeter)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Many in Minneapolis prepare for the holiday weekend. Here's what's happening
item.description: Protests against a surge of federal immigration officers into the city are continuing, while the threat of President Trump invoking the Insurrection Act hangs in the air.
item.content:encoded: Protests against a surge of federal immigration officers into the city are continuing, while the threat of President Trump invoking the Insurrection Act hangs in the air.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt

item.title: Grace and Manuel Rojas talk about their popular foam hats
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon asks Grace and Manuel Rojas about their popular foam hats, a riff on the cheese-shaped hats Green Bay Packers fans wear.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon asks Grace and Manuel Rojas about their popular foam hats, a riff on the cheese-shaped hats Green Bay Packers fans wear.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: A dedicated Missouri scout has achieved 140 merit badges
item.description: Only 21 merit badges are required to advance out of Eagle Scouts, the highest rank in Scouting America. One dedicated Missouri scout has earned 140--that was every merit badge offered by Scouting America during his time as a Scout.
item.content:encoded: Only 21 merit badges are required to advance out of Eagle Scouts, the highest rank in Scouting America. One dedicated Missouri scout has earned 140--that was every merit badge offered by Scouting America during his time as a Scout.
item.dc:creator: Lacretia Wimbley

item.title: Events in Minneapolis show how immigration enforcement has changed. What's the impact?
item.description: Minneapolis is at the center of sweeping, evolving federal immigration push. It demonstrates how different immigration enforcement is under Trump's second administration - and raises questions about the lingering effects on local communities and law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
Minneapolis is at the center of sweeping, evolving federal immigration push. It demonstrates how different immigration enforcement is under Trump's second administration - and raises questions about the lingering effects on local communities and law enforcement.

(Image credit: Adam Gray/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Trump is threatening to cut funding from sanctuary cities. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump says he's cutting federal money to sanctuary cities. But courts have blocked similar moves, ruling that the federal government can't use funding to coerce state and local governments.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he's cutting federal money to sanctuary cities. But courts have blocked similar moves, ruling that the federal government can't use funding to coerce state and local governments.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Major plumbing headache haunts $13 billion U.S. carrier off the coast of Venezuela
item.description: The crew of USS Ford is struggling to handle sewage problems on board the Navy's newest carrier.
item.content:encoded:
The crew of USS Ford is struggling to handle sewage problems on board the Navy's newest carrier.

(Image credit: Paige Brown)
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: They quit their day jobs to bet on current events. A look inside the prediction market mania
item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump's second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry's bonanza.
item.content:encoded:
Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump's second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry's bonanza.

(Image credit: Evan Frost for NPR and Meredith Nierman/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn
